intro: Cyphomandra uniloba, commonly known as the sour sop or custard apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshade plants. The plant produces large, hairy, green fruits that turn yellow when ripe. The fruit has a thick, aromatic skin and a soft, juicy interior with a sweet and tangy flavor. It is valued for its edible fruit and is often used in culinary applications.
